title: Surrender for Champselect
body:
Another person Q-dodging. Why? A toxicly minded individual, instalocking a position already called, insisting he can't play anything else. 

Why not instigate a surrender system where if a minimum of 4 out of the 5 people wish be removed from champ select, without the penalties of dodging - It can happen?

Thoughts?

replies.body:
I know the comments you're receiving so far are crass and to be expected, but like many people who care about their game experience and in the future, during ranked matches, their actual position in the ladder, I have thought of this and will agree with it being passed. The few examples you chose are only the most minor of the stupid shit that occurs during that opening 90 seconds and tbh, you are risking a bare minimum of 20 mins worth of you're precious time and enjoyment based completely around what could be (and has been) a group of floating turds, hell bent on blowing their shitty day into everyone else.

Why should I dodge and burn 5 mins of my life? Why should I lose LP because some jackass forces me to? I am actually shocked this isn't implemented already. You start a game and there it is, all the visible signs you're about to start digging in the pistol drawer and end it all, but guess what, you and 3 other people can be spared this unfair sabotage by immediately resetting the queue!

Easy.
Take the game and report the person after, they will get banned as that is a bannable offense.

Why don't you dodge and save urself the Trouble? It 5 min Penalty, -5lp and no MMR loss vs. 20 minutes Minium waste of time, -20 lp, -20 MMR and worse teammates in next game due to worse MMR.

bruh the whole concept is that you should be able to dodge a game if you and your team mates agree that someone's gonna mess things up without a penalty. he's comparing this idea to the 5 minute queue ban and the loss of a small amount of LP. not to the 20 minutes of game time and loss of LP that comes with losing the game.
